content: make a single_crochet base row a granny cluster = 3 double_crochet in the same space or stitch pg 16 www hodgepodge-crochet com the chains you skip in row 1 create the gaps you ll work into later from row 2 on you mostly put your hook into the big gaps between groups not into the tops of each double_crochet your chain 3 at the start of a row counts as a double_crochet when i say so below use your smaller crochet hook for this pattern block instructions row 1 first granny row no single_crochet row 1 chain 19 2 double_crochet in the 4th chain from the hook o the 3 chains you skipped at the start count as your first double_crochet o together that gives you 2 double_crochet in that same spot a little edge group 3 skip 2 chains work 3 double_crochet in the next chain o this makes your first granny cluster 4 repeat step 3 across the row o skip 2 chains 3 double_crochet in next chain o keep going until you have 3 chains left at the end 5 when 3 chains remain o skip 2 chains then work 2 double_crochet in the last chain 6 turn your work you should see 2 double_crochet at the start little 3-double_crochet clusters across the row and 2 double_crochet at the end row 2 granny stripes in the spaces 1-double_crochet edges 1 chain 3 this counts as your first double_crochet this is your edge stitch on this side 2 look at row 1 you ll see gaps spaces between the groups of stitches 3 work 3 double_crochet into each big gap between the groups all the way across the row o put your hook into the space itself not into the stitches 4 when you reach the last group double_crochet in the top of the last double_crochet from row 1 o this gives you 1 double_crochet at the end edge 5 turn row 2 has 1 double_crochet at each edge and granny clusters in the middle row 3 granny stripes 2-double_crochet edges 1 chain 3 this counts as your first double_crochet 2 double_crochet in the same stitch as the chain 3 o now you have 2 double_crochet at the start edge 3 again look for the big gaps between the 3-double_crochet clusters in row 2 4 work 3 double_crochet into each gap across the row 5 at the end of the row work 2 double_crochet in the top of the last double_crochet from row 2 pg 17 www hodgepodge-crochet com o this gives you 2 double_crochet at the end edge 6 turn row 3 has 2 double_crochet at each edge row 4 and up repeat row 2 then row 3 over and over o row 2 = 1 double_crochet at each edge granny clusters in the gaps o row 3 = 2 double_crochet at each edge granny clusters in the gaps keep repeating these two row until your square is about as tall as it is wide a nice
